title: 115_hr4245
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Electronic Health Record Modernization Oversight Act of 2017" provides oversight for the electronic health record modernization program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit various documents related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program to congressional committees within 30 days of the Act's enactment. These documents include an Integrated Master Plan, Schedule, Management Plan, cost estimates, Risk Management Plan, Health IT Strategic Architecture Plan, Transition Plan, and Data Migration Plan. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to submit various documents related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program to congressional committees, including a Data Migration Plan, System and Data Security Plan, Application Implementation Plan, System Design Documents, Legacy Veterans Information Systems and Technology Architecture Standardization, Security Enhancement, and Consolidation Project Plan, Health Data Interoperability Management Plan, and Community Care Vision and Implementation Plan. Quarterly updates must be provided throughout the program's duration. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit updated versions of various documents related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program to congressional committees, including the Integrated Master Schedule, Program Management Plan, Performance Baseline Report, Budget Reconciliation Report, Risk Management Plan, and contracts within 5 days of awarding. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must notify congressional committees within 10 days of any delays or financial adjustments exceeding $1,000,000 in the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must notify congressional committees within 10 days of any delays, financial adjustments, protests, claims, disputes, data loss, or breaches of patient privacy exceeding $1,000,000 in the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program. The Electronic Health Record Modernization Program requires the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to report to congressional committees within 10 days of any breaches of sensitive personal information exceeding $1,000,000. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report breaches of sensitive personal information exceeding $1,000,000 to congressional committees. This includes information related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program and any contracts or agreements for related activities. The House of Representatives passed the bill on May 21, 2018. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
